keyEvents.title: Hiriluk's Cherry Blossoms Cover the Island
keyEvents.description: Dr. Kureha fires cannons filled with Hiriluk's pink powder, turning the snow pink and making Drum Island appear covered in cherry blossoms.
keyEvents.significance: Fulfills Hiriluk's thirty-year dream and symbolizes the healing and renewal of Drum Island after years of suffering under Wapol's rule.

keyEvents.title: Citizens Witness the Miracle
keyEvents.description: The people of Drum Island witness the cherry blossoms covering their island for the first time, marking the beginning of healing for the nation.
keyEvents.significance: Represents the end of the island's suffering and the beginning of a new era of hope.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Prepare to Depart
keyEvents.description: With Chopper now part of the crew and Nami recovered, the Straw Hats prepare to leave Drum Island and continue to Alabasta.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of the Drum Island arc and the continuation of their journey.

statusChanges.description: The island begins healing from Wapol's tyrannical rule, symbolized by the cherry blossoms.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Decides to Join the Straw Hats
keyEvents.description: At Drum Castle, Chopper makes the decision to accept Luffy's invitation and join the crew.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Chopper's life changes forever as he commits to becoming a pirate.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Direct Recruitment
keyEvents.description: Luffy tells Chopper to shut up and join them in one of the most iconic recruitment scenes.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Luffy's leadership and the Straw Hats' unconditional acceptance.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Tells Kureha He's Leaving
keyEvents.description: Chopper announces to Dr. Kureha at the castle that he's leaving to become a pirate.
keyEvents.significance: A difficult but necessary conversation that shows Chopper's growth and courage.

keyEvents.title: Cannons Fired from the Castle
keyEvents.description: Kureha orders cannons to be fired from Drum Castle, shooting Hiriluk's powder into the sky.
keyEvents.significance: The castle serves as the launch point for Hiriluk's dream being realized.

keyEvents.title: Town Citizens Witness Cherry Blossoms
keyEvents.description: The citizens of Bighorn witness the pink snow falling and are moved by the sight of cherry blossoms covering their island.
keyEvents.significance: Represents the hope and renewal coming to the ordinary people of Drum Island.
